EmailTemplate.subject: Variable frequency control webinar December 5, 2018
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
View as web page <[[{{system.viewAsWebpageLink}}]]> Efficient and resilient future grids
Join us and hear what Dr. Steven Blair has to share about a new method of decentralized frequency control December 5, 2018 at 8am PST | 10am CST | 11am EDT Nokia’s partnership between the Energy Innovation Center and the University of Strathclyde, utilizing a Nokia SD-WAN to link multiple laboratories in real-time, has tested a new method of decentralized frequency control. This ability to rapidly balance the grid is key for integrating vast numbers of controllable, renewable generators and other resources. The fast-acting response – enhanced through new measurements and communications systems– is also critical for addressing the challenges associated with low-inertia power systems. The webinar will explain how this solution has been demonstrated, and how this can help enable efficient and resilient future grids. Speaker: Dr. Steven Blair Lecturer, University of Strathclyde Dr. Steven Blair holds the Nokia Lectureship at the University of Strathclyde, Glasgow, UK. He received the MEng degree in Computer and Electronic Systems in 2008, and the PhD degree in Electrical Engineering in 2013, both from the University of Strathclyde. His research interests include power system protection, communications, power quality, phasor measurement units, and real-time simulation. He is a member of IEC Technical Committee 57 Working Group 10 and CIGRE Working Group B5.64. © {{my.CopyrightYear}} Nokia.
